meanings.definition: Not using force or threats to make someone do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a noncoercive approach to encourage the students to participate in class discussions.
meanings.sent2: The noncoercive negotiation led to a peaceful resolution between the two parties.
meanings.sent3: The noncoercive invitation to the party made everyone feel welcome and excited to attend.
meanings.sent4: Her noncoercive leadership style inspired trust and loyalty among her team members.
meanings.sent5: The noncoercive parenting method focused on positive reinforcement and open communication.

meanings.definition: Not involving the use of force or threats to achieve a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: The noncoercive advertising campaign relied on creativity and persuasion to attract customers.
meanings.sent2: The noncoercive measures taken by the company aimed to promote employee well-being.
meanings.sent3: The noncoercive strategy of offering discounts encouraged more customers to visit the store.
meanings.sent4: His noncoercive coaching style emphasized collaboration and mutual respect.
meanings.sent5: The noncoercive decision-making process allowed for diverse opinions to be considered.
